column1: Lou Malnati's Pizzeria////You could strip each layer of the pizza and you'd unveil the craftsmanship behind the pie. The cheese is in-between the bottom layers of dough
column2: the sausage seems to be one huge slice instead of those balls of "sausage" that's usually sprinkled on top and the sauce--non-existent. Instead you get real pieces of stewed tomatoes. Oh yes
column3: it's heavenly. That crust is proof that butter works wonders. I couldn't get enough of the crispy
column4: flakey buttery crust that seriously could been the entire pizza and I would have been happy.
